thread.title: St. George artists called for exhibit
thread.title_full: St. George artists called for exhibit

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: St. George artists called for exhibit
text:
St. George artists called for exhibit Oct 23, 2015 
Tenants Harbor — Jackson Memorial Library invites visual artists of the Town of St. George to submit works for the “Holiday Fine Arts Exhibition” scheduled for Dec. 6 through Feb. 2. Artists must be full-time or part-time residents of St. George and older than age 18. 
Fine artworks in any traditional or non-traditional medium are welcome. All work must be two-dimensional, not larger than 30 inches in either dimension (including frame), ready to hang and for sale at a price of $350 or less. Artists may exhibit two works that conform to the requirements. 
The library retains a 30 percent commission for sold works. Registration for eligible artists is now taking place. For more information, contact Alane Kennedy, Exhibit Coordinator, at art@jacksonmemoriallibrary.org. 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com.
